Description:
FANTASTIC STARTER HOME OR EASY INVESTMENT
Positioned towards the end of a quiet, family-friendly court this weatherboard home is just minutes to shops, schools and Lake Weeroona. With a bus stop just down the road, the centre of Bendigo is only five minutes away.
A brick paved driveway under a double carport provides good off-street parking, and double gates allow secure vehicle access to the rear yard. The front door opens into an entry hall and character detail, such as high ceilings and decorative cornice, provide a great feel to the light-filled home. The hallway leads around to three good-sized bedrooms, all with built-in robes and ceiling fans, as well as a family bathroom.
Off the main entry is the spacious lounge and dining room. A gas heater sits in the original brick fireplace, and windows across the front of the home let in plenty of natural light. The dining room opens into a spacious kitchen with ample storage and modern appliances. A large laundry off the kitchen has a door leading out to the rear garden.
A decked alfresco space runs along the rear of the home, and additional separate undercover area with power and lights offers two outdoor living areas perfect for entertaining. The remainder of the garden is set to lawn with easy-care garden beds. A shed in the corner of the block provides additional vehicle storage.
Additional features include:
Ducted evaporative cooling
Split system heating and cooling
Ceiling fans throughout
Gas heating
Modern kitchen appliances including dishwasher, four-burner gas cooktop and oven
6m x 3.6m shed with concrete floor and power
Water tank
With plenty of opportunity to add value, this property is ideal for a buyer looking to step onto the property ladder and secure a home that doesnt require a great deal of work. Having served as a rental, the home would also suit an investor seeking an affordable and low-maintenance option in an established area.

Mid century magic with modern updates
1960s stylish home with contemporary modern updates.
The 1960s gave us pocket transistor radios, psychedelic coloured mini skirts, bold furniture and semi-modern brick veneer homes. It features amazing light-filled spaces including big entry foyer, large hallway, four bedrooms, generous main with new ensuite, and 3 other bedrooms with wall to floor built in robes, new large 3 piece family bathroom, beautiful large formal lounge with bay window and gas heater in a brick feature wall. The new kitchen boasts gas/electric cooking appliances, dishwasher, island bench/breakfast bar, good storage including pantry and spacious dining area all bathed in northern light.
Next to this is a great family /rumpus room, hardwood timber flooring with double French door access to a front patio and double doors to brilliant outdoor living highlighting covered and pergola areas overlooking the well-sized back garden
Added features include high ceilings, decorative 1960s cornicing, polished timber floors, two split system air conditioners, gas heating, storage cupboards tucked into every available space, wrought iron balustrade to the front terrace, double carport and garden shed.
Set on a corner allotment (approx 1017m²) the big backyard has side access and room to add shedding or a pool if desired, or plenty of room for the caravan, boat etc.
Well-located close to everything one looks for when buying property schools, public transport, local shops and cafes, medical facilities and the stunning Bendigo Botanic Gardens.
Already a proven rental performer, it will also appeal to investors.
Call for an inspection today.

Description:
COTTAGE CHARM IN AN ENVIABLE POSITION!
Situated in a sought-after White Hills position is this historic, character-filled and architect-influenced brick cottage offering scope as your own home, investment or supplementary income (yes, it is currently used for short-term accommodation - with constant clients).
Walk to Bendigo Creek walking tracks, schools and all the local shops, but best of all it is a stroll to White Hills Gardens and all the lovely features on offer there after its recent facelift.
The home boasts a superb custom-built kitchen with period-style cupboards, slate tiled floor, pot-drawers, walk-in pantry, dishwasher, gas hot plates and electric oven, ample bench space and a quirky microwave cavity; adjacent is the living area boasting a large reverse-cycle split-system, quality carpet and French Doors leading to the spacious, private alfresco space.
The dining room is cosy, features a slate floor and flows easily to the kitchen, it would also make a great private second living space. The three bedrooms are large, the main bedroom has its own reverse-cycle split system and a walk-in-robe; there's a second entry/foyer which would make a great study space and there is ample storage including a large walk-in linen press.
The bathroom is unique in shape and style, boasting a lovely claw-foot bath, large inset shower and a vanity basin made from a vintage timber cabinet; the laundry is of a similar taste to the bathroom and has outside access, adjacent is the separate toilet.
Outside is minimal maintenance with a private side yard with some foliage, a pond feature, paved brick and bluestone paths surrounding the home, local quarry rock retaining walls and a large paved area at the rear of the home which encompasses the covered alfresco space.
There is a shed/workshop with concrete floor, benches and built-in pegboard, a water tank and some additional storage.
The home has been re-floored, re-roofed and re-wired - you literally can walk in and do nothing; period features include pine-lined ceilings, feature brick walls (yes, the home is double brick), open fire places and an overall unique kerbside look and floor plan.
Worth viewing - it is one-of-a-kind in a one-of-a-kind location.
